Desc.entry: Produces the definitive map of public rights of way (public footpaths, bridleways and byways) for the area. Operates a general enquiries service for public rights of way and investigates complaints about obstructed paths etc (by appointment only). Maintains and signposts public paths. Deals with claimed paths and with the new Countryside and Rights of Way Act requirements. Encourages the use and enjoyment of public paths and the reporting back of any problems encountered. Runs the Adopt-a-Path scheme where members walk a specified route or network of paths in an area of their choice to ensure that they are in satisfactory condition and send in report forms. Organises talks and lectures on rights of way legislation, maintenance problems and offers general advice on rights of way matters.
